node.title: Space station crew forced to shelter from debris cloud caused by Russian missile
node.description: A Russian missile test that forced astronauts and cosmonauts aboard the International Space Station to take shelter is slammed as "dangerous and irresponsible" by US officials.
node.content:
["Russia has been slammed for conducting a \"dangerous and irresponsible\" missile test that blew up one if its own satellites and created a cloud of debris that forced the International Space Station's crew to take evasive action.", "US State Department spokesman Ned Price described the test as \"destructive\" at a briefing.", "\"Earlier today, the Russian Federation recklessly conducted a destructive satellite test of a direct ascent anti-satellite missile against one of its own satellites,\" Mr Price said.", "Anti-satellite (ASAT) weapon tests are rare, but have been criticised because of the risk they create for crews in low-Earth orbit.", "NASA said US astronauts Raja Chari, Tom Marshburn and Kayla Barron,\u00a0and European Space Agency astronaut Matthias Maurer, had to take shelter\u00a0in their docked capsules as the space station passed through the debris field.", "Russian cosmonauts Anton Shkaplerov and Pyotr Dubrov, as well as NASA astronaut Mark Vande Hei, sheltered in a\u00a0Soyuz spacecraft on the Russian segment.", "Both spacecraft can be used as lifeboats to bring crew back to Earth in an emergency.", "
Russia accused of 'weaponising'\u00a0space
", "James Dickinson, the general in charge of US Space Command, accused Russia of\u00a0continuing to \"weaponise\" space.\u00a0", "Russian space agency Roscosmos\u00a0downplayed the incident.", "\"The orbit of the object, which forced the crew today to move into spacecraft according to standard procedures, has moved away from the ISS orbit,\" the agency tweeted.\u00a0", "\"Friends, everything is regular with us! We continue to work according to the program,\" Mr Shkaplerov wrote in a tweet.", "
What are ASATs?
", "ASATs are high-tech space weapons possessed by few nations \u2014\u00a0only the US, Russia, China and India have demonstrated the ability to shoot down their own satellites.", "India was the last to carry out such a test in 2019, creating hundreds of pieces of \"space junk\" in a test that was strongly criticised by other powers, including the US.", "The US\u00a0shot down a satellite in 2008 and China demonstrated a similar knockout in 2007.", "Harvard astronomer Jonathan McDowell said the available evidence was consistent with such a test.", "Space-to-ground communications monitored by analysts spoke of a \"debris cloud\" rather than a particular piece of debris.", "\"What that tells me is that this is a recent event that they're talking about, not some well characterised, known, catalogued object, but a whole bunch of new objects that have not yet been catalogued,\" he said.", "The known orbital plane of Kosmos 1408, the Russian satellite destroyed in the test,\u00a0was consistent with a debris cloud that the ISS would encounter as it orbited the Earth every 93 minutes,\u00a0he said.", "\"I would say that more and more the feeling among people in the space industry is that we have way too much debris up there already. To deliberately generate more is just inexcusable.\"", "Mr McDowell said the first objects from the debris cloud should start to fall back into the atmosphere within a few months, but it could be up to 10 years before the cloud cleared\u00a0up entirely.\u00a0", "The Union of Concerned Scientists estimates there are currently more than 4,500 satellites in orbit, with companies like SpaceX planning to launch up to tens of thousands more.", "AFP/ABC"]
